page.title: 16COLD NORTON M.O.T CENTRE.
page.content: The M.O.T centre has been working for three years Before its 'present use as an MOT Centre the site was a contractors . The centre tests ,on average, about eight cars a day and of these approximately thirty three percent fail the M.O.T. Three people work there. Their major tools consist of a bench grinder a valve facer, a battery charger, a compresor, a welder, a rolling road and two car jacks. They have three thousand pounds worth of spanners. An MOT Centre tests how safe a car is. If it is unsafe it fails, for example it would fail on rotten suspension mountings or lights that didn't work. These faults then have to be put right before the car will be given its' certificate. All cars over three years old have to be tested once a year.
